explanation: The controlling expression 'if (1)' is an invariant (always true) and does not match either of the two exceptions in the rule text (it is not creating an infinite loop, nor is it a do-while with a constant false essentially-Boolean expression). Therefore this use of 'if (1)' violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. The surrounding preprocessor comments show it is used to combine two code paths, but that does not make the controlling expression non‑invariant. A compliant fix is to remove the conditional and use a plain block ( { ... } ) or restructure the preprocessor branches so no always-true controlling expression is present.
